Package gov.tak.platform.util

Class LimitingThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.tak.platform.util.LimitingThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, java.lang.Runnable
    public class LimitingThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Disposable
    Provides a processing capability where the action will only be run as fast as it can no matter how many calls to exec() are performed - but will guarantee the last most call to exec() will execute the run method of the runnable passed in.

    • Field Summary

      LimitingThread​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Runnable r)
      Construct a limiting thread with a name and a runnable which will be the worker code that is executed whenever the exec call is made on the limiting thread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LimitingThread

        public LimitingThread​(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.Runnable r)
        Construct a limiting thread with a name and a runnable which will be the worker code that is executed whenever the exec call is made on the limiting thread. If the system cannot keep up, intermediate executions are dropped and only the last exec is executed.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the limiting thread
        r - the runnable to be used that contains the logic to be run on the limiting thread.

    • Method Detail

      • exec

        public void exec()
        Called to perform the action as defined in the runnable used during creation. It is guaranteed that the action will be executed at least once of the runnable. If multiple calls are made, the execution of a runnable may be dropped in order for the limiting thread to catch up.

      • dispose

        public void dispose​(boolean join)
        Perform disposal of the limiting thread, canceling any future calls to execute.
        Parameters:
        join - if join is true, try to wait for the execution to finish of the last call to exec.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Releases all resources associated with the Object. The Object should not be used following an invocation of this method and any usage will result in undefined and possible application ending behavior.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
